comments:
3.0 RC1:

- Preferences > Java > Installed JREs > Search...
- select a folder, click OK 
=> busy cursor (hourglass) comes up, but no progress monitor, UI not blocked.

- click OK or Cancel before the search has finished
=> A cancellable "Searching ..." progress information dialog with empty
"Details>>" comes up
=> after the search has finished, this exception is written to the log:

The window is opened, but is behind all the other shells. It might get opened 
on a "null" shell? If we convert to a job, the progress service will take care 
of this for us.

InstalledJREsBlock.search() uses IProgressService.busyCursorWhile() to do it's search which I believe is 
correct. There are outstanding issues with using busyCursorWhile() from modal dialogs (see bug 64397) 
which may be the issue here.

The fix for bug 64397 addresses this as well. A progress dialog is now shown to the user while the 
search is being done.
Marking as WORKSFORME since no code changes were done to address this.
I guess you meant bug 64937. The other one has nothing to do with this.
